dismissalText.commentary: Najmul Hossain Shanto run out (Najibullah Zadran/Rahmanullah Gurbaz) 104 (105b 9x4 2x6 142m) SR: 99.04

dismissalComment.html: Shanto's innings is brought to an end with a slip! He reverse swept this and set away straight away. Once he realises it's straight at point, he looks to turn back but ends up loosing his footing. Ends up stranded on the floor halfway up the pitch as the stumps are broken. End of a fine innings.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim run out (Hashmatullah Shahidi/Gulbadin Naib) 25 (15b 1x4 1x6 17m) SR: 166.66

dismissalComment.html: And another run out! This was another slower ball that Shakib slapped hard at the fielder at extra cover, Mushfiqur had set off early and by the time he was sent back he was already half way down the track. Gulbadin does well to get back to the bowling crease to collect the throw and break the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Bowled 'im! It's a back-of-length offcutter and the lack of bounce does Rahmat Shah in as he looks to swing across the line. Taskin gets the breakthrough

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalComment.html: Quality take in the deep! This was short of a length and Nabi goes for the pull. He gets the height but not the distance. Afif at deep square leg, waits and waits and eventually holds on as the ball drops back down from orbit

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Clattered over deep midwicket! And, wait a minute, has he hit his own wicket?! Yes he has! Six and out, would you believe it! Mujeeb has gone so deep in his crease to swing at this that he's stepped on the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And that's that! Rashid goes for another big hit but only manages to top edge it to mid-off! Bangladesh win by 89 runs!

headshotImage.caption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: But maybe it matters not! Gurbaz misses his flick again and this time it's given. Gurbaz reviews, though. This is full on middle and leg and swinging in. Was there any bat? Nope. It's umpire's call on wickets, with the ball clipping the leg bail according to ball tracking, so Gurbaz has to go! The non-review does not cost Bangladesh any runs as Gurbaz is gone two balls later and Shoriful has provided a huge breakthrough

dismissalComment.html: Shoriful gets the last laugh! And he lets out a guttural scream! This was a back of a length delivery that Gulbadin drags on to the base of the stumps as he looks to swipe this across the line

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan c Shakib Al Hasan b Taskin Ahmed 24 (15b 3x4 1x6 22m) SR: 160

commentTextItems.html: And that's that! Rashid goes for another big hit but only manages to top edge it to mid-off! Bangladesh win by 89 runs!

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.40pm And that is that from us. We have Nepal taking on India tomorrow in Pallekele, be sure to join us for that. But until then on behalf of Abhimanyu, this Madushka signing out!

Shakib Al Hasan: We played very well all-round. It wasn't easy for the fielders to play 50 overs and come and bat, so we were really lucky to win the toss. [Mehidy promotion] He got his chance up the order and proved himself, we always knew he had the ability. We executed our plans really well, the fast bowlers especially bowled their heart out. This wasn't an easy wicket to bowl on."

Mehidy Hasan Miraz gets an award for the most sixes. He is also named Player of the Match: "I'm really happy. I think the team management believe in me. It was an excellent wicket, the ball was coming on easy so I just tried to strike through the line. It was an excellent partnership with Shanto."
Catch of the Match goes to Mushfiqur Rahim
Alright then, time now for the post-match presentation.

Getting a few questions regarding the qualification criteria, let me try and explain it as best as I can. Essentially, if SL lose tomorrow by a small margin they may remain above Bangladesh but Afghanistan can't go above Bangladesh. If Afghanistan win heavy to qualify, they may end up going above Bangladesh's NRR but they will impact SL's NRR so heavily that it will go below Bangladesh's. Basically, there is no scenario where BOTH Afghanistan and SL can end on a high NRR than Bangladesh.
What this means for Afghanistan is that they will require a big win against Sri Lanka in Lahore on Tuesday if they're to qualify to the next round.

This was a win built on the shoulders of Najmul Hossain Shanto and Mehidy Hasan Miraz, whose centuries laid the platform for their massive total. Then with the ball, the bowlers kept things tight, especially the spinners through the middle overs, before a flurry of wickets at the death owing to scoreboard pressure sealed Afghanistan's fate.

10.14pm So Bangladesh have done what they set out to do, they've beaten Afghanistan by such a margin that their NRR is strong enough that they won't end in last position regardless of the outcome of the SL-Afghan game, and thus have qualified for the Super 4s!

dismissalComment.html: Shanto's innings is brought to an end with a slip! He reverse swept this and set away straight away. dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Naim b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 28 (32b 5x4 0x6 41m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Mujeeb with a jaffa! It needed something special on this pitch to get a wicket and Mujeeb delivers that something special. It's a wrong'un that pitches just outside off on a length and straightens past the outside edge with Naim drawn forward in defence. Hits the off pole and Mujeeb is off in celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Najmul Hossain Shanto run out (Najibullah Zadran/Rahmanullah Gurbaz) 104 (105b 9x4 2x6 142m) SR: 99.04

dismissalComment.html: Shanto's innings is brought to an end with a slip! He reverse swept this and set away straight away. Once he realises it's straight at point, he looks to turn back but ends up loosing his footing. Ends up stranded on the floor halfway up the pitch as the stumps are broken. End of a fine innings.

headshotImage.caption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz lbw b Shoriful Islam 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: But maybe it matters not! Gurbaz misses his flick again and this time it's given. Gurbaz reviews, though. This is full on middle and leg and swinging in. Was there any bat? Nope. It's umpire's call on wickets, with the ball clipping the leg bail according to ball tracking, so Gurbaz has to go! The non-review does not cost Bangladesh any runs as Gurbaz is gone two balls later and Shoriful has provided a huge breakthrough

videos.title: Watch - Shoriful removes dangerous Gurbaz early

dismissalComment.html: Direct hit gets the man! This was short and the pull was scuffed to mid-on. The non-striker is backing up, not too far but far enough that he has to scamper back. But the throw is excellent and he's a few inches short

dismissalText.commentary: Mujeeb Ur Rahman hit wicket b Taskin Ahmed 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Clattered over deep midwicket! And, wait a minute, has he hit his own wicket?! Yes he has! Six and out, would you believe it! Mujeeb has gone so deep in his crease to swing at this that he's stepped on the stumps.
